content: bougainvillea blanket part v enclosure of central garden | trellis rounds 57 70 flowers in a future video designed by porzia sprovera 2025 2 index before you start………… …………………………………………… 3 video tutorials………………………………………………………… 4 support………………………………………………………………… … 4 recommended yarn and colors……………………………… … 5 abbreviations & appendix 5 languages ………………… 7 round 57 to 61 … …… ……………………………………… ……… 9 round 62 to 66… ………………………………………………… … 14 round 67 to 70………………………………………… ……… …… 16 appendix 5 languages………………………………………………… 19 3 before you start what you need to know about this pattern crochet terms us english only in this section skill level adventurous beginner hook 3 5 4 0 mm e g adjust to meet gauge gauge 10×10 cm / 4×4 in 20 single_crochet × 22 row 20 double_crochet × 8 row finished size of the blanket after blocking 140 x 140 cm / in format written instructions + step photos + 2 video tutorials beginning with round 57 this part of the pattern continues to grow the central garden and builds a deep trellis-style frame in camel the lapis rounds stabilise the center with dense texture the wisteria garland links back to the earlier green panel and the camel row create a sculptural architectural band that prepares the blanket for the final outer borders by the end of round 70 you ll have a solid gently curved frame around the garden the leaves and inner flowers are fully enclosed the stitch counts are balanced and the piece is ready for the next colour story and borders what you ll make foundation band r57 58 a dense lapis runway around the central panel first a ring of half_double_crochet then a textured fphdc round that locks the shape and gives a clear ledge for the next layers inner puff garland r59 soft wisteria border puff3 joined with slip stitches this creates a subtle floral halo between the greens and the coming camel trellis 4 arches & bridges r60 61 long camel trebles and chain arches that bridge down to the leaf round r49 forming decorative windows above the greens the first crossed treble pairs appear here sketching the curve of the future trellis wall layered trellis wall r62 68 successive rounds of crossed fptr pairs in camel with occasional slip-stitch anchors into the central panel to keep the fabric flat while the stitch count grows this section creates a deep architectural band around the garden final trellis band r69 70 the last two camel rounds complete the trellis a wide rhythmic texture of crossed trebles that frames the entire central garden and sets up a clean square edge for the next chapter skills front-post work fphdc and fptr working into blo and into earlier rounds building chained arches and managing stitch distribution on a large square to keep it flat video tutorials round 56 61
